description: From Latin castoreum, from Ancient Greek καστόριον (kastórion).

entries.meaning: The bitter exudate of the castor sacs of mature beavers.
examples: One of the substances tried was castoreum. […] If I were to judge from my own experience, I would say castoreum has very little therapeutic power, for I have not seen much benefit from its employment in those cases to which this remedy is said to be adapted.

entries.meaning: (archaic) A hat made from beaver fur.
